trans-unit.target: TEXT_KINGMB104_04883_SEQ_00<tab>Wuk Lamat needs to pay a visit to the palace.

TEXT_KINGMB104_04883_SEQ_01<tab>Wuk Lamat departs for Vollok Shoonsa, leaving you to your own devices. The suggestion to return to the For'ard Cabins and take a well-deserved rest, however, does sound very tempting...

TEXT_KINGMB104_04883_SEQ_02<tab>You head back to the cabins only to find a Landsguard soldier awaiting your arrival. It seems the Dawnservant has summoned you to the palace, and you are to present yourself to the gate guard stationed outside Sunperch.
TEXT_KINGMB104_04883_SEQ_03<tab>Heeding the soldier's advice, you proceed to your appointment dressed for battle. Yet for what reason might such preparations be warranted?

TEXT_KINGMB104_04883_SEQ_04<tab>Upon entering Sunperch, Gulool Ja Ja soon makes it clear that his summons was an invitation to duel. You spar against the massive Mamool Ja, his powerful and viper-fast blows keeping you on your toes, until he is at last satisfied with your performance. Impressed by your battlecraft, the Dawnservant follows the bout with a father's earnest request to watch over his daughter. It is then that Wuk Lamat arrives. She chides Gulool Ja Ja for stealing away her champion, and exits the throne room with you in tow.

TEXT_KINGMB104_04883_SEQ_05<tab>Annoyed by her father's antics, Wuk Lamat wonders if Gulool Ja Ja has been bothering you with things other than duels─a query you deflect with a noncommittal answer. The Dawnservant's plea remains at the forefront of your mind, however, as you accompany the Third Promise on the continuation of her journey.
TEXT_KINGMB104_04883_TODO_00<tab>Speak with Peshekwa.
TEXT_KINGMB104_04883_TODO_01<tab>Speak with the Sunperch guard.
TEXT_KINGMB104_04883_TODO_02<tab>Speak with the Sunperch guard.
TEXT_KINGMB104_04883_TODO_03<tab>Speak with Wuk Lamat.
TEXT_KINGMB104_04883_WUKLAMAT_000_002<tab>Right then, I have some things to take care of at the palace.
TEXT_KINGMB104_04883_WUKLAMAT_000_003<tab>While you can pass the time however you like, I'd suggest you head back to the cabins.
TEXT_KINGMB104_04883_WUKLAMAT_000_004<tab>After all, even heroes need to rest, and we still have a big journey ahead of us!
TEXT_KINGMB104_04883_MESSENGER04883_000_010<tab>At last...
TEXT_KINGMB104_04883_PESHEKWA_000_011<tab>Welcome back, <var 08 E905 ((madam)) ((sir)) /var>. You've had a Landsguard messenger most anxiously waiting on your return.
TEXT_KINGMB104_04883_MESSENGER04883_100_012<tab><var 2C ((<var 29 EB02 /var>)) (( )) 02 /var> of the Third Promise's entourage? I've been all over the city looking for you.
TEXT_KINGMB104_04883_MESSENGER04883_000_012<tab>The Dawnservant summons you to the palace. You are to present yourself to the gate guard stationed outside Sunperch at your earliest convenience.
TEXT_KINGMB104_04883_MESSENGER04883_000_013<tab>Oh, and one more thing: you are not to mention this visit to Wuk Lamat.
TEXT_KINGMB104_04883_GATEKEEPER4883_000_021<tab>The Dawnservant awaits you within. While I was not informed of the reason for your audience, in terms of attire, I would suggest full battle regalia.
TEXT_KINGMB104_04883_SYSTEM_000_030<tab>You must be a Disciple of War or Magic of level 92 or above to proceed.
TEXT_KINGMB104_04883_WUKLAMAT_000_040<tab>If he had his way, Papa would keep dueling until the day he dies.
TEXT_KINGMB104_04883_WUKLAMAT_000_041<tab>Even now, I know of only three people who didn't need to be carried away after their bouts: Zoraal Ja, your lance-wielding friend Estinien, and yourself.
TEXT_KINGMB104_04883_WUKLAMAT_000_042<tab>You really do live up to your fearsome reputation!
TEXT_KINGMB104_04883_WUKLAMAT_000_043<tab>I'm curious, though. Did Papa want anything else of you?
TEXT_KINGMB104_04883_Q1_000_000<tab>What will you say?
TEXT_KINGMB104_04883_A1_000_001<tab>A small favor, nothing more.
TEXT_KINGMB104_04883_A1_000_002<tab>Just a sparring partner.
TEXT_KINGMB104_04883_WUKLAMAT_000_045<tab>Well, if that's all it was...
